definition: to glean/to collect scraps/to eke out a meager living
to pick up/to collate or arrange/ten (banker's anti-fraud numeral)

sentences.english: You always live like a scavenger.
sentences.chinese: 念旧的人总活得像个拾荒者。

sentences.english: Rubbish collectors are following behind the procession picking up discarded bottles, bound to be making a big fortune today.
sentences.chinese: 捡废气瓶子的拾荒者跟在队伍后面，他们也收获颇丰。

sentences.english: Near the old Merchant Shipping Hall, a boy collects scraps in the rubble.
sentences.chinese: 在老商船会馆附近，一个男孩正在瓦砾堆中拾荒。

sentences.english: "It was a hard decision because there were lots of prejudices toward waste recyclers at that time, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 这是个艰难的决定，因为当时人们对拾荒者持有偏见。

sentences.english: The male members do odd-work such as rag picking and scrap dealing.
sentences.chinese: 家庭男性成员做像拾荒这样的临时工。

sentences.english: Especially in winter, ravens as scavengers, eating carrion, dead fish and garbage.
sentences.chinese: 尤其是在冬季，乌鸦的拾荒者，吃腐肉，死鱼和垃圾。

sentences.english: He jumped for entrepreneur from a "glean and collect scraps man", became a millionaire.
sentences.chinese: 他从一个“拾荒匠”一跃而为企业家，成了百万富翁。
一名拾荒者在歇一会儿。

sentences.english: The swagman who subsists on collects recyclable goods moves in the city.
sentences.chinese: 流浪汉在都市中移动并倚靠著拾荒以及资源回收维生。

definition: to set up a vendor's stall in the street
to drift about/to wander/to roam/nomadic/homeless/unsettled (e.g. population)/vagrant
to subsist/to eke out a living/to keep body and soul together
(coll.) father's father's mother/paternal great-grandmother/respectful form of address for an old woman
